results.title: After Biden’s Exposure to Trump, His Team Is Cagey on Health Questions
results.abstract: With transparency on health newly significant in the presidential race, Joe Biden’s safety protocols have remained largely under wraps. But on Sunday evening, his campaign said he had again tested negative for the coronavirus.
results.byline: By Thomas Kaplan, Apoorva Mandavilli and Katie Glueck

multimedia.caption: Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s health protocols have remained largely under wraps, with his campaign saying little about what steps it is taking to protect the 77-year-old candidate.

results.title: As Trump Seeks to Project Strength, Doctors Disclose Alarming Episodes
results.abstract: The president made a surprise outing from his hospital bed in an effort to show his improvement, but the murky and shifting narrative of his illness was rewritten again with grim new details.
results.byline: By Peter Baker and Maggie Haberman

results.title: Trump Confronts a New Form of Risk, More Personal and Perilous
results.abstract: With his political career, his business dealings and his reputation, the president has long bet that he can ride out difficulties. Now, though, he is facing an entirely unfamiliar threat.

results.title: ‘Real Change’: A Race Is On to Register Ex-Felons in Florida
results.abstract: Activists armed with millions of dollars from donors like Michael Bloomberg and LeBron James are canvassing in Florida to help former felons register to vote before a deadline on Monday.

results.title: Kamala Harris’s Doubleheader: A Debate and Hearings With Sky-High Stakes
results.abstract: She is viewed as a gifted cross-examiner whose instincts for televised verbal combat are one of her greatest political strengths, but this is a new challenge.
results.byline: By Sydney Ember and Lisa Lerer

multimedia.caption: Fiery exchanges have become a hallmark of Senator Kamala Harris’s political career, and were a building block for the core message of her primary campaign that she could prosecute President Trump.

results.abstract: American Crossroads is wading deeper into Republicans’ fight to keep the Senate with North Carolina ads, renewing partisanship questions at the Postal Service, where a PAC leader has a powerful post.

results.title: Trump Isn’t ‘Out of the Woods,’ but We’re in the Dark
results.abstract: Few things are more important than the president’s health — and the mixed messaging about his condition is putting the United States at risk.

results.title: For the Secret Service, a New Question: Who Will Protect Them From Trump?
results.abstract: Central to the job is a willingness to say yes to the president no matter what he asks. Now, that means subjecting an agent’s health to the whims of a contagious president.

results.title: Judges Tell Trump His Officials Are Serving Illegally. He Does Nothing.
results.abstract: Three high-ranking administration officials have been found by courts to be working in violation of a 1998 law that governs how a president can appoint temporary officials.

results.title: ‘The Coal Industry Is Back,’ Trump Proclaimed. It Wasn’t.
results.abstract: The demise of coal-fired power plants in Arizona and Kentucky shows how the president, despite promises to restore jobs, failed to counter the forces decimating the industry.
